page.title: 06EDUCATION.
page.content: There is no school in Church Brampton;children having to attend the Bramptons school in a nearby village.There is a primary school in Harlestone.There are no secondary or middle schools in the area. There are thirty children attending Harlestone school.The ages range from four to eleven.Most of the children live within walking distance. There are two classes and two teachers. The Headmistress has been at the school for three years.The school is part of the Rural Schools Project and Peripatetic help is available for reading and music.A Charity fund helps provide books and equipment and the school has a computer and modern Audio/ Visual Aids.There is a canteen but no meals are cooked on site.The school was rebuilt after a fire in 1977.
